intro: Burdachia sphaerocarpa, commonly known as the globe-fruit burdachia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spherical, fleshy fruits that resemble small, green apples. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Burdachia sphaerocarpa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and desert regions.
